titlepage.titleproper: Guide to the University of Chicago. Recorder's Office. Records1904-1933
titlepage.author: Finding aid prepared by EMS, 1992

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: University of Chicago. Recorder's Office. Records

address.addressline: Hanna Holborn Gray Special Collections Research Center

did.abstract: The Recorder's Office Records consist of two volumes relating investigations of student misconduct and disciplinary action taken against students between 1908 and 1933; a volume regarding degrees conferred before 1893 by the Old University of Chicago and by the Baptist Union Theological Seminary; and published reports of the Recorder’s Office, 1904-1908.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

prefercite.head: Citation
prefercite.p: When quoting material from this collection, the preferred citation is: University of Chicago. Recorder's Office. Records, [Box #, Folder #], Hanna Holborn Gray Special Collections Research Center, University of Chicago Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope Note
scopecontent.p: The Recorder's Office Records consist of two volumes relating investigations of student misconduct and disciplinary action taken against students between 1908 and 1933; a volume regarding degrees conferred before 1893 by the Old University of Chicago and by the Baptist Union Theological Seminary; and published reports of the Recorder’s Office, 1904-1908.
